did.abstract: David F. Greenberg is the author of Crime and Capitalism: Readings in Marxist Criminology and several other books, and a professor of sociology at New York University. This collection contains the manuscript of the unpublished anthology, "Behind Bars: The Prison Experiences of War Resisters," edited by David F. Greenberg and Beverly D. Houghton. The anthology contains essays by resisters to the Vietnam War regarding their experiences in various prisons and jails. The collection also includes material from the New American Movement (NAM): newspapers, internal discussion bulletins, and others.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by David Greenberg in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.065.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by David Greenberg was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions about this collection made prior to 2024 have not been recorded.
In June 2024, materials from Box 1 were rehoused into four manuscript boxes (1, 3-5). At this time, materials were also placed in archival folders.
